I asked about this problem on the newsgroup last week. 

Title: Properties in Java Perspective
Date:  Friday 12:54PM

but there's been no response.  

Here's the body of the text I put on the newsgroup(without the pictures).

I'm having a problem with the following registrations: 

  <!-- 
    JET properties settings 
  --> 
  <extension point="org.eclipse.ui.propertyPages"> 
    <page 
        id="JETSettingsPropertiesPage" 
        name= "%_UI_JETSettings_label" 
        objectClass="org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject" 
        class="org.eclipse.emf.codegen.presentation.JETPropertyPage"> 
      <filter name="nature" value="org.eclipse.emf.codegen.jet.IJETNature"/> 
    </page> 
  </extension> 

  <!-- 
    JET properties settings 
  --> 
  <extension point="org.eclipse.ui.propertyPages"> 
    <page 
        id="JETSettingsPropertiesPage" 
        name= "%_UI_JETSettings_label" 
        objectClass="org.eclipse.jdt.core.IJavaProject" 
        class="org.eclipse.emf.codegen.presentation.JETPropertyPage"> 
      <filter name="nature" value="org.eclipse.emf.codegen.jet.IJETNature"/> 
    </page> 
  </extension> 

The intent is that the properties are only accessible for projects with a JET 
nature. The first registration works well in the
resource perspective, i.e., only projects with a JET nature display properties.  
But the second registration works poorly in the
Java perspective, because the properties are available even when the Java 
project doesn't have a JET nature: 

 -- no picture--

It should look like this when the nature is there: 

 -- no picture--

Am I doing something wrong or is there something wrong with the filtering of the 
properties pages for the Java perspective?

I don't think I'm doing anything wrong so I think this is a bug in the filtering 
of propery pages in the Java perspective.  Could someone please look at this?  
If I've done something wrong, could you please suggest what I should do right. 
;-)

Thanks.



Ed Merks/Toronto/IBM@IBMCA
mailto: merks@ca.ibm.com
905-413-3265  (t/l 969)
This is not a JDT/UI bug. It is EMF.

Sorry, I was only looking at the stack trace which has nothing to do with 
JDT/UI. 

The problem should be fixable by adding the adaptable attribute to the XML. I 
am not a contribution expert but it should read like this:

  <extension point="org.eclipse.ui.propertyPages"> 
    <page 
        id="JETSettingsPropertiesPage" 
        name= "%_UI_JETSettings_label" 
        objectClass="org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject"
        adaptable="true" 
        class="org.eclipse.emf.codegen.presentation.JETPropertyPage"> 
      <filter name="nature" value="org.eclipse.emf.codegen.jet.IJETNature"/> 
    </page> 
  </extension> 

Using the adaptable attribute make the contribution for the IJavaProject 
obsolete since a IJavaProject adapts to IProject. So you must remove it. 

Please let me know if it works.

Cool!  That worked.  Thanks for the good advice!
This will be fixed in our next drop.
